intro: Gnaphalon saxatile, commonly known as the stone cranesbill, is a perennial flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Europe and North Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, pink or purple flowers. The plant has hairy leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It is adapted to rocky and dry soils, often growing in crevices or on slopes. Its botanical features make it a resilient and hardy species suitable for xerophytic environments.
